meta.name: AI-powered LinkedIn Content Generator with OpenAI GPT-4 and DALL-E

name: Automated LinkedIn Content Creation with GPT-4 and DALL-E on top of a UI

parameters.text: =You are a linkedin content creator and copywriter. Given the title {{ $json.body.title }}, the rationale {{ $json.body.rationale }}, and suggested hook: {{ $json.body.hook }}. Generate text content for a linkedin post. Also describe a suitable image for the post.

=You are an SEO specialist for LinkedIn. Your task is to generate highly relevant and effective hashtags for the following post. Consider the post's content, target audience, and current LinkedIn trends to maximize visibility and engagement.

<post_title>{{ $json.output['post title'] }}</post_title>
<post_content>{{ $json.output['post content'] }}</post_content>

Please generate:
1. **3-5 broad, high-volume hashtags** (e.g., #AI, #Marketing, #Business)
2. **3-5 niche-specific hashtags** that are directly relevant to the post's core topic (e.g., #SocialMediaAutomation, #ContentCreationAI, #LinkedInMarketingTips)
3. **1-2 trending/topical hashtags** if applicable (e.g., #FutureOfWork, #DigitalTransformation)

Present them as a comma-separated list.

parameters.content:
## Step 1 - Generate topics
This webhook expect two values: 
1. api_key: this should be an OpenAI key 
2. prompt: this should be a detailed prompt giving the AI information about your context

Here's an example of what the API call needs to look like

![](https://cdn.weweb.io/designs/d8eabf49-48a9-4c2f-995c-594936425772/sections/api_call_for_topics.png?_wwcv=1754315044747)

## Output 
This webhook returns a list of 6 items, each containing a title, hook, and rationale for writing about the topic:

![](https://cdn.weweb.io/designs/d8eabf49-48a9-4c2f-995c-594936425772/sections/topics_output.png?_wwcv=1754315497587)

Save this list in your UI builder so users can edit it and reference it later.

## Step 2 - Generate a post & related hashtags
This webhook expects an OpenAI API key (api_key) and information about the post you want to generate (title, hook, rationale)

The API call from your UI builder will look something like this:

![](https://cdn.weweb.io/designs/d8eabf49-48a9-4c2f-995c-594936425772/sections/api_call_for_post.png?_wwcv=1754315778347)

## Why 3 webhooks? TL;DR: to give users full control over AI outputs

Many n8n templates use an all-in-one AI agent, which is great for saving time. However, we structured this template a bit differently. The goal: give end-users more control over the AI-generated content.

This template is designed to serve as the backbone of a UI built with an app builder like WeWeb. The interface includes three screens:
1. Create topics
2. Edit topics and generate posts
3. Edit posts and generate images

Each screen has its own dedicated webhook. This ensures users are 100% in control of the content thatâ€™s generated and published to their LinkedIn account.

If you'd like to connect this n8n template directly to a WeWeb UI, it's possible. The WeWeb template is available for free [right here](https://go.weweb.io/zoYeg5g).

## Output

This webhook returns an item with a post title, post content, and an image description:

![](https://cdn.weweb.io/designs/d8eabf49-48a9-4c2f-995c-594936425772/sections/post_output.png?_wwcv=1754316208986)

Save this in your UI builder so users can edit and reference it later.

## Step 3 - Generate an image
This webhook expects an image description (imgDescription) and an OpenAI key (api_key). 

The API call might looks something like this:

![](https://cdn.weweb.io/designs/d8eabf49-48a9-4c2f-995c-594936425772/sections/api_call_for_image.png?_wwcv=1754317807201)

## Output
This webhook returns an image encoded in base64 format:

![](https://cdn.weweb.io/designs/d8eabf49-48a9-4c2f-995c-594936425772/sections/image_output.png?_wwcv=1754317807206)

You will need to convert it to a Blob in your frontend to display it.
